types.name: Account
types.description:
# Account type

Recall that a smart contract and an account are the same thing in the
context of the TVM-based Blockchain, and that these terms can be used
interchangeably, at least as long as only small (or “usual”) smart contracts
are considered. A large smart-contract may employ several accounts lying in
different shardchains of the same workchain for load balancing purposes.

An account is identified by its full address and is completely described by
its state. In other words, there is nothing else in an account apart from
its address and state.

fields.name: acc_type
fields.description:
Returns the current status of the account.

- 0 – uninit
- 1 – active
- 2 – frozen
- 3 – nonExist

fields.name: bits
fields.description:
Contains sum of all the bits used by the cells of the account. Used in
storage fee calculation.

fields.name: boc
fields.description: Bag of cells with the account struct encoded as base64.

fields.name: cells
fields.description:
Contains number of the cells of the account. Used in storage fee
calculation.

fields.name: code
fields.description: If present, contains smart-contract code encoded with in base64.

fields.name: code_hash
fields.description: `code` field root hash.

fields.name: data
fields.description: If present, contains smart-contract data encoded with in base64.

fields.name: data_hash
fields.description: `data` field root hash.

fields.name: due_payment
fields.description:
If present, accumulates the storage payments that could not be exacted
from the balance of the account, represented by a strictly positive
amount of nano tokens; it can be present only for uninitialized or
frozen accounts that have a balance of zero Grams (but may have
non-zero balances in non gram cryptocurrencies). When due_payment
becomes larger than the value of a configurable parameter of the
blockchain, the ac- count is destroyed altogether, and its balance,
if any, is transferred to the zero account.

fields.name: init_code_hash
fields.description: account 's initial code hash (when it was deployed).

fields.name: last_paid
fields.description:
Contains either the unixtime of the most recent storage payment
collected (usually this is the unixtime of the most recent transaction),
or the unixtime when the account was created (again, by a transaction).

fields.name: library
fields.description: If present, contains library code used in smart-contract.

fields.name: library_hash
fields.description: `library` field root hash.

fields.name: proof
fields.description:
Merkle proof that account is a part of shard state it cut from as a bag
of cells with Merkle proof struct encoded as base64.

fields.name: public_cells
fields.description:
Contains the number of public cells of the account. Used in storage fee
calculation.

fields.name: split_depth
fields.description: Is present and non-zero only in instances of large smart contracts.

fields.name: state_hash
fields.description:
Contains the representation hash of an instance of `StateInit` when an
account is frozen.

fields.name: tick
fields.description:
May be present only in the masterchain—and within the masterchain, only
in some fundamental smart contracts required for the whole system to
function.

fields.name: tock
fields.description:
May be present only in the masterchain—and within the masterchain, only
in some fundamental smart contracts required for the whole system to
function.

fields.name: workchain_id
fields.description: Workchain id of the account address (id field).

types.name: AccountEventEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of nodes.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: events
fields.description:
This node could be used for a cursor-based pagination of account
events (aka outgoing external messages).

args.name: first
args.description: This field is mutually exclusive with 'last'.

args.name: last
args.description: This field is mutually exclusive with 'first'.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Account information.

types.name: BigIntFormat
types.description:
Due to GraphQL limitations big numbers are returned as a string. You can
specify format used to string representation for big integers.

enumValues.name: HEX
enumValues.description: Hexadecimal representation started with 0x (default)

enumValues.name: DEC
enumValues.description: Decimal representation

fields.name: boc
fields.description: Serialized bag of cells of this block encoded with base64.

fields.name: chain_order
fields.description:
Collection-unique field for pagination and sorting. This field is
designed to retain logical order.

fields.name: created_by
fields.description: Public key of the collator who produced this block.

fields.name: end_lt
fields.description: Logical creation time automatically set by the block formation end.

fields.name: file_hash
fields.description: Shard block file hash.

fields.name: gen_utime
fields.description: uint 32 generation time stamp.

fields.name: global_id
fields.description: uint32 global block ID.

fields.name: key_block
fields.description: true if this block is a key block.

fields.name: master_seq_no
fields.description: seq_no of masterchain block which commited the block.

fields.name: min_ref_mc_seqno
fields.description: Returns last known master block at the time of shard generation.

fields.name: prev_key_block_seqno
fields.description: Returns a number of a previous key block.

fields.name: prev_vert_ref
fields.description: External block reference for previous block in case of vertical blocks.

fields.name: start_lt
fields.description:
Logical creation time automatically set by the block formation start.
Logical time is a component of the Acki Nacki Blockchain that also plays
an important role in message delivery is the logical time, usually
denoted by Lt. It is a non-negative 64-bit integer, assigned to
certain events. For more details, see the Acki Nacki blockchain
specification.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Returns block processing status:
- 0 – unknown
- 1 – proposed
- 2 – finalized
- 3 – refused

fields.name: status_name
fields.description: Returns block processing status name.

fields.name: version
fields.description: uin32 block version identifier.

fields.name: workchain_id
fields.description: int64 workchain identifier.

types.name: BlockchainAccountEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: info
fields.description: Account information (e.g. boc).

args.name: byBlock
args.description: Optional block hash. If byBlock is specified then the account info will be returned from the shard state defined by the specified block. Otherwise the account info will be returned from the last known shard state.

fields.name: messages
fields.description:
This node could be used for a cursor-based pagination of account
messages.

args.name: allow_latest_inconsistent_data
args.description: By default there is special latency added for the fetched recent data (several seconds) to ensure impossibility of inserts before the latest fetched cursor (data consistency, for reliable pagination). It is possible to disable this guarantee and to reduce the latency of realtime data by setting this flag to true.

args.name: counterparties
args.description: Filter messages by counterparties (max - 5 counterparties).

args.name: msg_type
args.description: Filter messages by type (multiple are allowed, all messages if not specified).

args.name: min_value
args.description: Optional filter by min value (unoptimized, query could be dropped by timeout).

args.name: first
args.description: This field is mutually exclusive with 'last'.

args.name: last
args.description: This field is mutually exclusive with 'first'.

args.name: archive
args.description: Defines query scope. If true then query performed on a maximum time range supported by the cloud. If false then query performed on a recent time range supported by the cloud. You can find an actual information about time ranges on evercloud documentation.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: This node could be used for a cursor-based pagination of account transactions.

args.name: allow_latest_inconsistent_data
args.description: By default there is special latency added for the fetched recent data (several seconds) to ensure impossibility of inserts before the latest fetched cursor (data consistency, for reliable pagination). It is possible to disable this guarantee and to reduce the latency of realtime data by setting this flag to true.

args.name: min_balance_delta
args.description: Optional filter by min balance_delta (unoptimized, query could be dropped by timeout).

args.name: max_balance_delta
args.description: Optional filter by max balance_delta (unoptimized, query could be dropped by timeout).

args.name: first
args.description: This field is mutually exclusive with 'last'.

args.name: last
args.description: This field is mutually exclusive with 'first'.

args.name: archive
args.description: Defines query scope. If true then query performed on a maximum time range supported by the cloud. If false then query performed on a recent time range supported by the cloud. You can find an actual information about time ranges on evercloud documentation.

It is possible to disable this guarantee and to reduce the latency of realtime data by setting this flag to true.

types.name: BlockchainTransactionsEdge
types.description: An edge in a connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description:
Creation unixtime automatically set by the generating transaction.
The creation unixtime equals the creation unixtime of the block
containing the generating transaction.

fields.name: dst
fields.description: Returns destination address string.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Info
types.description: GraphQL Server info

fields.name: batchSize
fields.description: The maximum number of records returned by the request.

fields.name: blocksLatency
fields.description: Blocks latency in ms (server time - max of blocks.gen_utime * 1000).

fields.name: chainOrderBoundary
fields.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL**
Reliable upper boundary for pagination by chain_order field. Before this
boundary data inserts are almost impossible (work in progress to
make them fully impossible when the feature goes into production).

fields.name: endpoints
fields.description: Alternative endpoints of q-server.

fields.name: lastBlockTime
fields.description: Last block time in ms (maximum value of blocks.gen_utime * 1000).

fields.name: latency
fields.description:
Overall latency (maximum value of blocksLatency, messagesLatency and
transactionsLatency).

fields.name: messagesLatency
fields.description:
Messages latency in ms (server time - max of messages.created_at *
1000).

fields.name: time
fields.description: Server unix time in ms.

fields.name: transactionsLatency
fields.description:
Transactions latency in ms (server time - max of transactions.now *
1000).

fields.name: version
fields.description: Server version.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional whole numeric values.

fields.name: boc
fields.description: A bag of cells with the message structure encoded as base64.

fields.name: body_hash
fields.description: `body` field root hash.

fields.name: bounce
fields.description:
Bounce flag. If the transaction has been aborted, and the inbound
message has its bounce flag set, then it is “bounced” by
automatically generating an outbound message (with the bounce flag
clear) to its original sender.

fields.name: bounced
fields.description:
Bounced flag. If the transaction has been aborted, and the inbound
message has its bounce flag set, then it is “bounced” by
automatically generating an outbound message (with the bounce flag
clear) to its original sender.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Represents contract code in deploy messages.

fields.name: code_hash
fields.description: `code` field root hash.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description:
Creation unixtime automatically set by the generating transaction.
The creation unixtime equals the creation unixtime of the block
containing the generating transaction.

fields.name: created_lt
fields.description: Logical creation time automatically set by the generating transaction.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Represents initial data for a contract in deploy messages.

fields.name: data_hash
fields.description: `data` field root hash.

fields.name: dst
fields.description: Returns destination address string.

fields.name: dst_chain_order
fields.description:
Collection-unique field for pagination and sorting. This field is
designed to retain logical output order (for logical input order use
transaction.in_message).

fields.name: dst_transaction
fields.description: Acki Nacki transaction

fields.name: dst_workchain_id
fields.description: Workchain id of the destination address (dst field).

fields.name: fwd_fee
fields.description:
Original total forwarding fee paid for using the HR mechanism; it is
automatically computed from some configuration parameters and the
size of the message at the time the message is generated.

fields.name: ihr_disabled
fields.description: IHR is disabled for the message.

fields.name: ihr_fee
fields.description:
This value is subtracted from the value attached to the message and
awarded to the validators of the destination shardchain if they
include the message by the IHR mechanism.

fields.name: library
fields.description: Represents contract library in deploy messages.

fields.name: library_hash
fields.description: `library` field root hash.

fields.name: msg_type
fields.description:
Returns the type of message.
- 0 – internal
- 1 – extIn
- 2 – extOut

fields.name: proof
fields.description:
Merkle proof that message is a part of a block it cut from. It is a
bag of cells with Merkle proof struct encoded as base64.

fields.name: src
fields.description: Returns source address string.

fields.name: src_chain_order
fields.description:
Collection-unique field for pagination and sorting. This field is
designed to retain logical output order (for logical input order use
transaction.in_message).

fields.name: src_transaction
fields.description: Acki Nacki transaction

fields.name: src_workchain_id
fields.description: Workchain id of the source address (src field).

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Returns internal processing status according to the numbers shown.
- 0 – unknown
- 1 – queued
- 2 – processing
- 3 – preliminary
- 4 – proposed
- 5 – finalized
- 6 – refused
- 7 – transiting

fields.name: tick
fields.description:
This is only used for special contracts in masterchain to deploy
messages.

fields.name: tock
fields.description:
This is only used for special contracts in masterchain to deploy
messages.

fields.name: value
fields.description: May or may not be present

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination in a connection

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: QueryOrderBy
types.description:
Specify how to sort results. You can sort documents in result set using more
than one field.

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description:
Path to field which must be used as a sort criteria. If field resides
deep in structure path items must be separated with dot (e.g.
"foo.bar.baz").

types.name: QueryOrderByDirection
types.description: Specify sort order direction

enumValues.name: ASC
enumValues.description: Documents will be sorted in ascended order (e.g. from A to Z)

enumValues.name: DESC
enumValues.description: Documents will be sorted in descendant order (e.g. from Z to A)

fields.name: blockchain
fields.description: Blockchain-related information (blocks, transactions, etc.)

fields.name: boc
fields.description: Bag of cells with the account struct encoded as base64.

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: balance_delta
fields.description:
Account balance change after the transaction. Because fwd_fee is
collected by the validators of the receiving shard, total_fees value
does not include Sum(out_msg.fwd_fee[]), but includes
in_msg.fwd_fee. The formula is:
balance_delta = in_msg.value - total_fees - Sum(out_msg.value[]) -
Sum(out_msg.fwd_fee[])

fields.name: chain_order
fields.description:
Collection-unique field for pagination and sorting.
This field is designed to retain logical order.

fields.name: code_hash
fields.description:
Code hash of the account before transaction execution.
If an account was not activated before execution then this field
contains code hash after account execution.

fields.name: compute
fields.description:
Code hash of the account before transaction execution. If an account was
not activated before execution then this field contains code hash
after account execution.

fields.name: end_status
fields.description:
The end state of an account after a transaction, 1 is returned to
indicate a finalized transaction at an active account.
- 0 – uninit
- 1 – active
- 2 – frozen
- 3 – nonExist

fields.name: ext_in_msg_fee
fields.description: Fee for inbound external message import.

fields.name: lt
fields.description:
Logical time. A component of the TVM-based Blockchain that also plays an
important role in message delivery is the logical time, usually
denoted by Lt. It is a non-negative 64-bit integer, assigned to
certain events. For more details, see [the TON blockchain specification](https://test.ton.org/tblkch.pdf).

fields.name: master_seq_no
fields.description:
seq_no of masterchain block which commited shard block containing the
transaction.

fields.name: new_hash
fields.description: Merkle update field.

fields.name: old_hash
fields.description: Merkle update field.

fields.name: orig_status
fields.description:
The initial state of account. Note that in this case the query may
return 0, if the account was not active before the transaction and 1
if it was already active.
- 0 – uninit
- 1 – active
- 2 – frozen
- 3 – nonExist

fields.name: outmsg_cnt
fields.description:
The number of generated outbound messages (one of the common transaction
parameters defined by the specification).

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Transaction processing status.
- 0 – unknown
- 1 – preliminary
- 2 – proposed
- 3 – finalized
- 4 – refused

fields.name: total_fees
fields.description:
Total amount of fees collected by the validators.
Because fwd_fee is collected by the validators of the receiving shard,
total_fees value does not include Sum(out_msg.fwd_fee[]), but includes
in_msg.fwd_fee. The formula is:
total_fees = in_msg.value - balance_delta - Sum(out_msg.value[]) -
Sum(out_msg.fwd_fee[])

fields.name: tr_type
fields.description:
Same as above, but reserved for non gram coins that may appear in the
blockchain.
Transaction type according to the original blockchain specification,
clause 4.2.4.
- 0 – ordinary
- 1 – storage
- 2 – tick
- 3 – tock
- 4 – splitPrepare
- 5 – splitInstall
- 6 – mergePrepare
- 7 – mergeInstall

fields.name: tt
fields.description: VM debug trace.

fields.name: workchain_id
fields.description: Workchain id of the account address (account_addr field).

fields.name: no_funds
fields.description:
The flag indicates absence of funds required to create an outbound
message.

fields.name: account_activated
fields.description:
The flag reflects whether this has resulted in the activation of a
previously frozen, uninitialized or non-existent account.

fields.name: exit_code
fields.description:
These parameter represents the status values returned by TVM; for a
successful transaction, exit_code has to be 0 or 1.

fields.name: gas_credit
fields.description:
This parameter may be non-zero only for external inbound messages.
It is the lesser of either the amount of gas that can be paid from the
account balance or the maximum gas credit.

fields.name: gas_fees
fields.description:
This parameter reflects the total gas fees collected by the validators
for executing this transaction. It must be equal to the product of
gas_used and gas_price from the current block header.

fields.name: gas_limit
fields.description:
This parameter reflects the gas limit for this instance of TVM.
It equals the lesser of either the Grams credited in the credit phase
from the value of the inbound message divided by the current gas price,
or the global per-transaction gas limit.

fields.name: msg_state_used
fields.description:
This parameter reflects whether the state passed in the message has been
used. If it is set, the account_activated flag is used (see below).

fields.name: success
fields.description: This flag is set if and only if exit_code is either 0 or 1.

fields.name: vm_final_state_hash
fields.description:
This parameter is the representation hashes of the resulting state of
TVM.

fields.name: vm_init_state_hash
fields.description:
This parameter is the representation hashes of the original state of
TVM.

fields.name: vm_steps
fields.description:
the total number of steps performed by TVM (usually equal to two plus
the number of instructions executed, including implicit RETs).

fields.name: due_fees_collected
fields.description:
The sum of due_fees_collected and credit must equal the value of the
message received, plus its ihr_fee if the message has not been
received via Instant Hypercube Routing, IHR (otherwise the ihr_fee
is awarded to the validators).

fields.name: storage_fees_collected
fields.description: This field defines the amount of storage fees collected in grams.

fields.name: storage_fees_due
fields.description:
This field represents the amount of due fees in grams, it might be
empty.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type
validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution
behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally
including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing
additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned
in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which
has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes
all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry
points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
description of __Schema for newer graphiql introspection schema
requirements

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description:
If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will
be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description:
If this server support subscription, the type that subscription
operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds
of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about
that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and
description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface
types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface,
provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose
other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid
fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are
valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: A reason for why it is deprecated, formatted using Markdown syntax

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates that an Input Object is a OneOf Input Object (and thus requires exactly one of its field be provided)

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Provides a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.

args.name: url
args.description: URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
